## Check for NA's
```{r}
colSums(is.na(data_training))

data_training %>%
 filter(is.na(reviews_per_month), number_of_reviews == 0 )
# We have a lot of NA#S in the reviews_per_month columns -> set to 0 should do the Job
# Also host_name and name can be replaced by no_name, since there are not a lot of information missing goin to lose.
```
```{r}

data_training$reviews_per_month <- replace_na(data_training$reviews_per_month, 0)
colSums(is.na(data_training))
```
